intro: Pauridia ovata, commonly known as the ovalleaf pauridia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Pauridia ovata is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
